definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)

sentences.english: Tracy: She took her first beauty title when she's 21.
sentences.chinese: 她在21歲的時候首次摘取了“選美皇后”頭銜。

sentences.english: You want to win and comrade-in-arms with the crown the god of war you?
sentences.chinese: 你想和戰友一起摘取戰地之神的桂冠嗎？

sentences.english: The Serpent tempted Eve to pick the forbidden fruit.
sentences.chinese: 那條毒蛇誘使夏娃摘取禁果。

sentences.english: Can you take eggs from a dying woman?
sentences.chinese: 可以從垂死的婦女體內摘取卵子嗎？

sentences.english: Here there is low-hanging fruit ripe for the picking.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一個低垂的成熟果實等待摘取。

sentences.english: From these specifics, you can then extract more general, solution-oriented needs statements like those in Table 2.
sentences.chinese: 從這些方面，你能夠摘取更多的綱要，如表2。

sentences.english: She took her first beauty title when she's 21.
sentences.chinese: 她在21歲的時候首次摘取了“選美皇后”頭銜。

sentences.english: Pick them for dinner perfectly well.
Bai Suzhen laughs in the face of death, selects the ganoderma lucidum immortal grass finally, excited goes.
sentences.chinese: 白素珍捨生忘死，終於摘取靈芝仙草，興奮而去。

sentences.english: Take representative plots from literature to help illustrate your idea you want communicate throu. your talk.
sentences.chinese: 摘取代表性的示意圖，幫助闡明學術觀點。

sentences.english: It plucks beautiful roses from brambles for us.
sentences.chinese: 它從刺叢之中爲我們摘取美麗的玫瑰。

sentences.english: Many donated kidneys are removed laparoscopically, through small keyhole incisions .
sentences.chinese: 很多待移植腎臟也都通過小切口經由腹腔摘取過。

sentences.english: To pick up the star that will take us to our dream.
sentences.chinese: 摘取屬於自己的那顆夢想的啓明星。

sentences.english: In sailing, for example, Yin Jian won China's first medal when she took windsurfing gold.
sentences.chinese: 比如帆船，殷劍摘取了中國帆板的第一塊金牌。

definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
fruit (produced by a plant)/(fig.) fruits (of success etc)/results/gains
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to cut off a section of sth
to pick/to select/to take/to capture (data)/to acquire/to pick up (a signal)
